summary: An FBI email chain from August 7, 2019, discussing operational planning for a search warrant execution on Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little St. James. It details travel logistics, personnel coordination, and the status of the investigation, including co-conspirator service and evidence processing.

persons.name: Sean
persons.context: Author of the main operational email, leading the planning for the search warrant execution on Little St. James island. He is with Squad C-20, Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking, FBI New York office.

persons.name: RDT
persons.context: An FBI agent being sent ahead to the Virgin Islands to handle logistics (lodging, transportation, coordination) for the upcoming search operation.

events.title: Warrant Swearing in St. Thomas
events.description: Case agents are sent to St. Thomas to swear out the search warrant for Little St. James island.

events.title: FBI Team Travel to Virgin Islands
events.description: The main FBI team plans to fly down on the FBI O400 plane, arriving around 7pm, in preparation for the search warrant execution.

events.title: Search Warrant Execution on Little St. James
events.description: Planned execution of the search warrant on Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little St. James, scheduled for 6am. The search is anticipated to take 1-3 days.

locations: Little St. James (Epstein's island, Virgin Islands)
San Juan Division (SSRP St. Thomas RA)
keyFacts: All but one of the identified co-conspirators had been served; the remaining one was a British citizen currently unavailable.
The FBI was actively planning a major search operation on Epstein's 70+ acre private island, Little St. James, involving coordination with CBP, the Coast Guard, and local authorities.
Digital media seized from Epstein's residence was being processed by CART and was nearly ready for review.
Victim and witness interviews were ongoing, and SDNY was working with lawyers on co-conspirator cooperation.
The operational plan involved securing transportation, vehicles, food, water, and supplies for a multi-day search of the island's several structures and one large house.
